author: ETAV8R
title: Great printing and new hood.
review: LEGO continues the Native American line with the new Ice Fisherman. This appears to be an Inuit ready to get some fish. The printing is only on the front but is very neat. Definitely looks warm. The new hood is a nice addition. I can imagine an arctic party with lots of these figures. I will be getting a couple more copies of this one.

author: AETerry
title: Ice Fisherman Review
review:
First we get the Fisherman, then the Gnome with a fishing pole and now this guy.

The only real reason I went looking for him is to have another color variation of fishing pole for my MOCs. Plus the warm hooded parka hood the minifigure has.

The figure is decent enough in concept and design with the print job and hood accessory piece for the head to show an Inuit bundled up for the cold Northern reaches of the Arctics. I'd have done tan colored hands to show he's got mittens or gloves on too. Otherwise there isn't a whole lot about this figure that really stands out as a wow factor.

Low points for Build and Parts are of course due to this being a minifigure with an accessory or two and not much more then that.

Collectors will certainly want to grab this figure up for Series 5.

author: LEGOSLUG
title: The Ice Fisherman gets his dinner at last.
review:
Here is my review of the set 8805-5 Ice Fisherman.

I didn't get to feel this bag-The shop I went to had them in a glass cabinet.  

The Minifigure:

The male Ice fisherman is a great minifigure, because you can actually change the head to a female figure, if you have a spare head. Nice printing on the torso as well, and as a bonus, the Fisherman comes with a fishing rod, a line, and a fish. The only thing that's missing is a BBQ! The minifigure can hold on to the Fish, and you can hook the fish on to the line. The minifigure comes with a stand as well, and looks quite cute when you stand it there with the Rod line and fish.

Conclusion:

A great addition to your collection. It really is good, so are the other minifigures, so if you don't get it, ah well, but if you do, awesome. 5/5

LEGOSLUG

P.S. Please take a look at my other reveiws, and my bricklists.

author: Snowtrooper119
title: Catch of the series
review: I was very lucky to get hold of this minifigure. He is just fantastic. This minifigure has some wonderful accesories such as the green fish and the briliant tan hood. He has a face that has been seen many times before but it looks really suitable inside the hood. The detailing is superb and I really like the torso and leg printing that shows stiches and fur, implying that it is homemade and that an animal was harmed in the making of it. The fishing pole with the green fish on the end is a nice touch too. I really like this minifigure (especially the hood) and I think that if you get you will not be dissapointed.

author: sideswinger
title: a cool figure!
review:
The fourth figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 5 is the Ice Fisherman. This figure was released in 2011, retailed for three dollars, and includes 8 pieces. So let's take a closer look!

On top, we have that excellent hood piece. I love how that looks, with the very complex fur moulding all around it, and there's even some wrinkle moulding on the sides. I also really like how that light brown colour is printed all around it. And what's even cooler, is that I think that might've been new for the figure.

Next is his face, which has a great print. I like the chipper smile, and I like the cheekbone printing on the sides of the mouth. I also really like how generic and plain it is, because it can be used in many situations with many figures. No alternate expression.

Next is his torso print, which looks pretty good. I like the bits of fur printing, and something I really like about him, is that he has those strings to tighten the hood hanging down on the torso. That's just a really nice extra bit of printing that is greatly appreciated. However, he has no back torso printing, which is a bit sad.

Next is his legs, which have some more detailed printing. I really like the fur all over it, and I also like how that peach colour is printed. I do kind of think he needs side leg printing to elaborate on the bits of fur some more, but it's not a huge deal.

And his accessories are pretty great! He has a fishing pole, and that consists of three pieces: the pole, the string, and the fish. The pole, while it isn't new to the figure, has a nice reddish-brown colouring, and I love how long it is. I also like the studs on the bottom, as well as the clip on top. He also has that black string, which has a stud on one side and a pole on the other. I love how the string wraps around the pole and clips to the clip on top. Lastly, he has that sand green fish, which connects to that pole. I like the colour its caste in, and I love how LEGO included it.

And that's it for the figure! Overall, this is a very solid and great figure. As I've said in all my previous Series 5 reviews, I love almost every figure in this series, and this one is no exception. Though he isn't my favourite, he's definitely one of them. I just like the concept, and I think it was executed well, with the prints, moulds, and pieces.

And thanks for reading!
